snippet: Who wants to practice medicine in a country where they use power tools in surgery? The dilemma of doctors in the developing world.
abstract: Matt McAllester article describes the dilemma facing many doctors from the developing world, who are drawn to the United States by big salaries and state-of-the-art facilities; health care workers who emigrate from poorer nations, where hospitals are understaffed and underfinanced, can be conflicted about leaving their native countries and are often the targets of hostility by those left behind.
lead_paragraph: Who wants to practice medicine in a country where they use power tools in surgery? The dilemma of doctors in the developing world.

headline.main: America Is Stealing the World’s Doctors
headline.print_headline: Who Wants to Practice Medicine in A Country Where They Use Power Tools In Surgery?
